signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-ti: SignalsLink.EP - Integration between the Signals and Electrical Progressive mods
signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-te:
SignalsLink.EP
Extends the mod Signals with components that work with the Electrical Progressive mod.

Electrical Progressive
EP switch
A signal-controlled switch. Allows turning the flow of electric current on or off.
If there is a signal on the input, the switch is on. If there is no signal on the input, the switch is off.
EP meter
Provides information about the state of the electrical network to which the meter is connected.
If there is signal 1 on the input, the output signal shows the charge level of batteries in the network.
If there is signal 2 on the input, the output signal shows the production/consumption balance of electricity. Values 1-7: consumption exceeds production, 8: consumption=production, 9-15: electricity production exceeds consumption.
If there is another signal on the input, the output is signal 0.
